WRITING.TEXT:
Almost all of the characters on Mad Men are awful in one way or another, but they are interesting and well developed; not just annoying and the show itself has a plot that you want to follow. I think it also helps that Mad Men is a period piece; we all know people with those bad traits but the context of the show makes it more novel and entertaining since those traits are being shown in situations that we ourselves don't experience.
I know people like the characters on Girls and they drive me crazy, why would I want to come home and watch a show about them?
Thanks! I'm only a second year but right now I'm aiming for peds ED/trauma (I like the idea of dealing with short term problems and I've been told I have the personality/ADHD for it)
I mean we Baker act people with anorexia and bulimia when they are in medical danger and it becomes clear that they can't make sound decisions due to their disease.
Depends on the perspective. I know a lot of people like peds because kids are able to bounce back from things and go on to live long lives where adults don't get better they just don't get worse.
Yeah I'm aiming for peds because even with obese kids and teenagers I am still bigger than the majority of kids at 5'8" and 120 pounds where I am smaller than the average adult.

I like it because flavored yogurts are too sweet. I'll either eat it as is with some fruit or cereal, or add a little bit of honey.
Also, plain NONFAT yogurt sucks ass. I only eat low fat (which is 1.5-2% depending on the bran) and it is so much richer, creamier and less weird and bitter. My dietician wants me to start eating whole milk yogurt but I can't imagine I'd be able to eat a meaningful amount with how rich it must be.

I grew up drinking seltzer because my mom loves it but I didn't realize that it was kind of an east coast/New England thing until I moved to Ohio for school and couldn't for the life of me find just plain old, store brand carbonated water.
I think Lunchable chicken nuggets are even worse than the pizza (I've never had either but the idea of a cold, shelf stable chicken nugget is appalling to me).
I'm fine with the taste but the texture makes me gag.

Flexibility is SO important as you get older as it reduces your risk for falls (and if you do fall you are more likely to be able to get yourself up) and you need pretty good ROM to complete a lo of ADLs independently.

I agree!
I make a lot of jokes about my "Catholic guilt" but in reality I go to mass because I want to and my relationship with God is one of the most consistently positive and uplifting things in my life.

ARE YOU ME?? I'm a half black practicing Catholic but I have always kind of wished I was brought up Jewish because I agree with a lot of the tenets, and like you have had overwhelmingly positive experiences with all of the Jewish people I have met in my life.
I think that is part of why I have stuck with Catholicism, I like that I can go to mass almost anywhere and know what to expect. Obviously faith is important to me but darn do I love rituals.
Monthly confession appointment Catholic?
I feel so blessed to have found my liberal, social justice oriented Catholic church!

Boots are just so hard to size because there are just so many different variables.
Mine are always too big at the top (I have pencil legs with ballerina calves) but the real issue is they are always too short because I have pretty small feet for someone who is a leggy 5'8''

Always balance your outfits!
If you are wearing a tight/revealing top, don't also wear super tight short shorts.
They knocked down my schools Kroghetto and are building us a shiny new one!
Its $3.99 at the Kroger near me, its actually cheaper than Ben and Jerry's

Ballet and strength training. I struggle with compulsive overexercising so I need my exercise to be somewhat self limiting. Ballet class is over when its over and I'm not creative or strong enough to spend more than an hour lifting so its harder for me to go overboard.
Ballet has honestly been good for my body image; I like seeing what my body can do and I notice how much weaker I feel and look if I don't eat enough before class. My teachers have always been pretty body positive (or at worst, neutral) and always emphasized that we need to be strong and technically excellent, not delicate waifs.
I miss running and cardio but I know ballet keeps me in good shape and that I can't control myself once I open that can of worms.
I love grocery shopping! Sometimes I go to Kroger or Whole Foods just to browse...

If a PT isn't in your budget right now try taking group classes! They are a lot cheaper than a 1 on 1 session but you still have an instructor to correct your form and show you how to do movements correctly.

I'm a pharma brat so I moved a lot as a kid but all of our moves were corporate relocation, I didn't know that most people didn't have movers come pack up their houses for them when they moved until quite recently.

Pick up after me.
I have no problem with cleaning (my stove, bathroom and floors are spotless) but I can't be bothered to just put things away so my apartment always looks like a mess.

I loved Lo Loestrin but I had to switch to an estrogen pill because my doctor was worried about my bone density (I have anorexia). I just use the extended cycles so I only have 4 periods a year (in theory, I still skip them) but its not the same gosh darn it!

There is a hypothesis that the gay male community developed such a focus on physical appearance due to the AIDs crisis: being in good shape was a way to show that you were "clean" since AIDs patients were wasting away looking healthy was really important.

I love the classic and the angsty teen in me loves American Idiot and Bare.
Jesus Christ Superstar and Hair will always hold a special place in my heart because they were the first professional productions I was ever cast in.
I also love Spring Awakening (the broadway revival was amazing), A Little Night Music, The Book of Mormon, The Light in the Piazza and of course, Hamilton.
I LOVE the R H version of Cinderella!

Intelligence
Drive to learn new things
Compassion/caring nature
Persistance and determination
I look awesome with my head shaved.
Yep! I actually have my mom ship me the food service loafs that they sell at Costco because the Udi's that they sell at Kroger is tiny (and 90% holes)
I feel like there is a difference between what you are describing and trying to live in an echo chamber where you only hear views that support and validate yours.
Be Well!
Yeah mine doesn't do pelvics unless you are sexually active, having an issue that needs assessment or over 21.

Its also good to start going to the gyno before you "need" to just to make sure that everything is in good working order, and to get your questions answered.
My pediatrician always recommended that girls start going when they were around 16 no matter what. Even if you aren't sexually active or having any problems it is good to get comfortable with the experience, have questions answered by a professional and a lot of girls who should be going don't because they don't want to have to bring up the idea that they are sexually active with their parents.
Yup, and since theatre is a pretty small community if you have an attitude with one costumer EVERYBODY will hear about it.

Barf.
I'm a nursing major and yeah, it can be challenging but good lord so is literally any other science based undergraduate degree once you get past the basics.

I'm a nursing major and we actually have lectures about how unacceptable stuff like this is and how degrading it is to our profession.
If we want to be treated like the educated professionals that we are we can't act like immature martyrs on Facebook.

I'm biracial and my mom was so worried about learning how to care for my hair (she is as white as they come). My dad is an only child who had only ever had short hair and his family lived on the other side of the country when I was little so my mom would literally just go up to nice looking black ladies in the haircare aisle of Target and ask them what to do with my hair (I was born in the mid 90's so she didn't have the luxury of google).
She did not want me to have "white mom hair"
I think some white people worry that they would be invading a space that is typically seen as "safe", where people all relate to each other because of a shared characteristic.

See, I dislike people who get mad that I am chipper in the morning!
I get that not everyone is as peppy as me but it bothers me that some people think that it is acceptable to be downright rude because it is 7 o'clock in the morning.
Hello Elsevier my good friend
My lower belly gets visibly distended when my bladder is full and after a day or 2 of constipation I have a visible "poop baby"
A lot of my motivation to run comes from my desire to live up to my evolutionary potential!
I'm a nursing major and we learned that you should always ask the patient to describe their reaction to anything they say that they say they are allergic to.

See, belly is my preferred term because its general ("stomach" refers to a specific organ and I'm a stickler about using it to refer to your entire abdominal region, and saying abdomen just sounds pretentious) but doesn't make me want to barf like "tummy"
Some of them are super lovey (basically giant, dumb dogs). Others have to be in the mood and some like their personal space.

I have kind of the opposite problem I'm biracial (1/2 white, 1/2 black but most people assume I'm black until told otherwise) and I feel completely out of place when I wear more 'black' styles because I grew up in a very white area and have almost no connection to modern black culture.

Well right now, zero because my doctor doesn't want me to exercise until I can get my weight and blood pressure up a bit/stop fainting when I stand up too fast.
I usually intentionally exercise (go to the gym, run, take a ballet class etc.) 6 days a week.
I don't have a car so I walk a lot but I don't count that as exercise since its just part of being a functional human.

Little kids tend to spike really high fevers because their bodies are still figuring out this whole 'being human' thing, unless they are acting super sick, showing other alarming symptoms or not responding to treatments most doctors will tell parents not to worry and to just make a sick appointment for the next day, or to go to the ER if it doesn't go down within a set period of time.
Honestly, I would be much more concerned about a kid with a much lower fever who was acting lethargic or not eating than a kid with a scary high fever that was engaged and easily roused from sleep.
For me there is a difference between goal oriented shopping and recreational shopping.
Thats adorable!

Actually, its pretty common for bulimics to abuse laxatives as a way of purging (people with other eating disorders abuse them too, either to purge or to relieve the gosh awful constipation that comes from restricting your intake.)
We call first year engineering majors "pre-business" majors.
You just HAD to make things about you (/s)

(Former) biracial kid here!
I think the biggest thing that you have to worry about is learning how to deal with their hair! I'm half black and came out with a full head of curly hair that my mom had no idea how to care for.
Obviously questions about race will come up and I think that kids should be aware of their backgrounds but it doesn't need to be a 'thing'. I've never felt insecure in my racial identity and it honestly never occurred to me that I should be until people started trying to reassure me or ask me if it was an insecurity.
Yeah as a biracial person it bothers me too. Its super weird to hear girls my age talking about how they want to have "mixed" babies because they're so cute like... I'm a human not a laberdoodle
I passed out in class which was super annoying because I have been drinking enough water and I had a good breakfast so my body was just being a jerk.

I like the predictability of being home. I'm a bit of a control freak and I like doing things myself; because I like doing things 'my way' and I know what results I can expect. Novel experiences can be fun but I really like coming home to my routines and schedules.
I know a Griffin (he's in his early 20s now) so your little guy isn't alone!

I have a very dear friend named Dagny!
She's not a fan of her name because she is super liberal (I think she turned out that way to spite her parents).

My sister was the same way!
Unless we were having something special for breakfast (first day of school waffles or 'mom is feeling domestic french toast') she would eat leftovers or heat up some chicken noodle soup for breakfast.

I don't even know what my size is! I pack myself into 30Es but I know that I need a smaller band and a larger cup. Honestly I dislike my boobs so much I don't want to think about what size they actually are (and how much bras in that size cost)
My mom only let me drink "big girl wine" this summer and now my beloved Yellow Tail moscato tastes way too sweet.

I love Lexapro except it COMPLETELY kills my sex drive.
TBH I didn't even know that people it was normal to want sex because I've been on it since I was 12 and nobody warned me about that side effect because ya know, nobody was really worried about whether or not suicidal 12 year old me was horny.

I love scheduling and planning things (making appointments, grocery lists, schedules, meal planning). I also love grocery shopping; I have been known to go to the grocery store just to walk around and browse.
Basically, my hobby is being a personal assistant.

YES! Tried reading it when I was 6; wasn't into it.
Tried again when I was 8 or 9 thinking I was too young to get it the first time.
Tried AGAIN in high school thinking that maybe I would at least be able to appreciate it as something that wasn't aimed at my demographic.
I've never made it to the halfway mark of that book.
Honestly, working out does motivate me to eat more because I know that I'm just wasting my time when I try to workout after heavily restricting, but I guess I still struggle to eat more than I burn.

"A Wrinkle in Time"
I've tried to read it at least 5 times over the years and I've never been able to get into it.

I have an eating disorder and my weight is too low for me to safely exercise so I've been sitting on my butt since Thursday and I'm so restless and now I have no healthy outlets for my stress.
I was making good progress (gainz, mile times coming down) but then I got a stomach bug and lost 5 pounds and I feel like I'm going to end up back to square one.

I didn't start making my bed until I moved into a studio apartment and I had to look at it all of the time.
I feel so much less stressed when my surroundings look clean (which is why I spent last night mopping the kitchen instead of studying for the exam that I have tomorrow...)
My dad always hated that show because of how presumptuous the title was (he also disliked how Ray's character just let his mother shit all over his wife).
TBH I really can't watch Friends because Joey is the only likeable character and I spend the whole episode wishing he would go find some better, less annoying people to spend his time with.

YES! I love The Office but it infuriates me that Micheal is till allowed to succeed and end up happy.
I want to watch him crash and burn and face the reality of his incompetence.

Ice cream is my go to.
Carbs tend to "clump up" and they're really hard to get out if you've had a large volume of them.
I have an eating disorder and my doctor and dietician are trying to get me to drink smoothies and eat nuts so I can put on weight and not have to eat an overwhelming volume of food!
So this baby weighs as much as I did in second grade... I was thin but I've always been tall and muscular for my age so I was a dense kid.

I FEEL YOU ON THIS! I'm really struggling with my eating disorder right now (managed to bargain my way out of leaving school for inpatient for now by agreeing to a weight contract) so this really strikes a nerve.
I LIKE exercise and I WANT to do it 6 days a week, but right now I need to sit on my ass and eat or I will be forced to completely derail my education. I wasn't even trying to lose weight, but because my brain is fucked up I managed to put myself back in the "danger zone" so now I need weekly doctor appointments and lab work to make sure my organs haven't started shutting down.
I could rant for ages but I probably shouldn't haha.

Type 1 causes lose weight if it isn't controlled because the body isn't producing insulin so none of the glucose that you take in can actually be absorbed into your cells and used as energy. Instead, it just stays in the bloodstream and gets peed out, so patients are super hungry, crazy thirsty and lose a ton of weight until things get under control.
Most of the type one diabetics are solidly in the middle of the healthy BMI range.
I'm planning on doing a pub quiz type thing (each table is a team for a Jeproady style trivia game).
Ugh I haven't been able to find this anywhere!

Yup! My boyfriend is a college rower, I'm a runner/ballet dancer/118 weakling who tries to lift but we both like being active so we can at least go to the gym at the same time and do other 'active' things together. Plus, we can relate to each others stories about our activities.

If I'm making coffee at home I drink it black or I'll add a packet of Splenda and a little bit of cinnamon if I'm feeling fancy.
If I go to Starbucks I usually get sugar free vanilla syrup and sometimes a splash of sooy or skim milk.
My birth plan is very similar: "give me all of the drugs and get this thing out of me whatever way you think is best"

I'm not "into healthy living", I have an anorexia/orthorexia and compulsively exercise. I function pretty well but my diet and exercise habits aren't a choice, they are my main coping mechanism and I can't deal if I am unable to workout or eat my carefully planned meals. I'm a picky eater with celiac disease so its pretty easy to convince people that my bringing my own food everywhere is normal. I am obsessed with food, I spend way too much time on Pinterest looking for ways to get the most volume for my calories and just staring at recipes for things I could never let myself eat.
Nobody that I go to college with has ever seen me at a healthy weight so everyone thinks that I'm a naturally thin, small framed person not someone with a larger frame who is at least 15 pounds underweight.
I have made some progress; I rarely purge and I do eat 3 meals a day every day, even if I only eat so I have the energy to workout and do well in school and I limit myself to "safe" foods.
Change your sheets every week and change your pillow case even more frequently if you are having trouble with acne.

I'm a full time college student so my wardrobe is pretty casual. I spend about 95% of my life in either scrubs, workout clothes or the "college girl uniform" (Norts/leggings and an giant t-shirt)
My essentials: Leggings
North Face Backpack (it holds EVERYTHING and still looks nice after years of daily use)
Patagonia fleece (lecture halls are cold!)
Oversized cardigans, so I can look like a grownup in leggings and a tank and because I'm always cold.
LLBean boots
Birkenstocks
Tevas
Sports bras that don't give me uniboob
Hats (beanies to keep my head warm in the winter and baseball caps for when I workout/run because I have super short hair so I need something to absorb sweat or it all ends up in my eyes)
Yup, and I also believe in science!

I miss being able to eat without feeling guilty and doing a lot of math. I miss being able to just eat until I feel satisfied. Heck, I miss wanting to eat and not seeing it as a chore that keeps me out of the hospital.
Anorexia is fun.

My professors are such shitlords and I love it. They are big on treating all patients with dignity and compassion no matter what they weigh but we have a big focus on health promotion.
In our freshman intro class we had an assignment where we had to use MFP and track for a week to see how much we were really eating. They're pretty big on "if you're not taking care of yourself you can't take good care of your patients."

I have IBS-C and vasovagal syncope which means I pass out if I clench down too hard.

I love the TaTa Tamer!

I thought it was too until I realized that almost none of my well educated upper middle class relatives can swim. Many of them live in country club neighborhoods that HAVE POOLS and go on Caribbean vacations so its not like they don't have exposure to bodies of water, swimming just isn't seen as an essential skill in a lot of black communities and a lot of moms really don't want their kids to swim because it will mess up their hair.
